did.head: Collection Overview

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: Collection of 92 pieces of sheet music, chiefly from the United States, most with title page illustrations.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Collection of Sheet Music, circa 1790-1950, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection compiled by the Music Library from a combination of purchases and gifts.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 92 pieces of sheet music, 77 of which were published in the United States, 13 in England, and 1 each in Ireland and France. The musical content is split almost evenly between piano music and vocal music with piano accompaniment. The piano music includes works in dance forms, including galops, waltzes, polkas, marches, Schottisches, quadrilles, and mazurkas. The topical subjects of the music and illustrations (43 of which are in color) American Civil War battles and persons, the transatlantic cable, and celebrities of the stage.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by composer surname, followed by title.

unittitle.title: Modlitwa dziewicy ; arranged
Maiden's prayer for the piano forte,

note.p: Although the title Prière exaucée is stated on the title page, the music matches the work titled Prière d'une vierge.
Title page illustration: a woman kneeling in prayer / printed by P. S. Duval and Son.
New York (N.Y.): Wm. A. Pond and Co.
Dedicated to Mrs. R. D. Holmes.
Color title page illustration: portrait of ballerina Mdlle. Bonfanti / lithographed by Major and Knapp Eng. Mf'g. and Lith. Co.
Bird song parts indicated on music.
Dedicated to the Lady Patrons [of the Promenade Concerts].

O take me to thy heart again,

unittitle.title: Tarnation strange
Tarnation strange, or Yankee wonders : comic song sung by Mr. Buckingham at the Royal Gardens Vauxhall,

note.p: Caption title: Tarnation strange, or Yankee wonders, written by the American Boz, composed by T. Blewett. Blewitt, or Blewett, is possibly a pseudonym of publisher James Hewitt rather than English composer Jonathan Blewitt. Copy trimmed, with loss of information.
Title page illustration: five comic scenes with lyrics beneath them depicting various situations described in the lyrics.

note.p: Dedicated to Miss Marshall. Full publication statement: Londres : Cramer, Beale & Co. ; Paris : Brandus & Co. ; Philadelphia : G. André & Co.
Color title page illustration: wreath of flowers around title text.

Title page illustration: a man playing a lute on a street to a woman above looking out from a window.
New York (N.Y.): Wm. A. Pond and Co.
Drum and fife parts indicated on music.
Dedicated to Mr. Josh Hart. Composed, arranged and performed with great success by Harrigan and Hart.
Title page illustration: Harrigan & Hart in Mulligan guard uniform, with an African American boy in background holding a sign reading "M.G.".
Written and sung by John Brougham and dedicated to his friend Oliver C. Wyman of Boston.

New York (N.Y.): William Hall and Son
Dedicated to Miss Rebecca S. Burge.

New York (N.Y.): Firth, Pond and Co.
Dedicated to S. P. Wardwell of Providence, R. I.
Title page illustration: family sitting by a fire in the parlor / lithographed by Sarony and Major.
New York (N.Y.): Firth, Pond and Co.
Title page illustration: portrait of Cyrus W. Field surrounded by flags, ships, and an ocean telegraph line side view / lithographed by Sarony, Major, and Knapp.

Dublin (Ireland): Gough's Piano Forte, Harp, and Music Warehouse
Dedicated to Lieutenant Colonel Shirley and the officers of the 7th (Queen's Own) Hussars.
Color title page illustration: a soldier riding on a horse / lithographed by M. and N. Hanhart.

unittitle.title: Four bells polka
Four bells polka : composed as a companion to the popular "Three bells polka",

note.p: Addressed to Miss Elizabeth Nelson, dedicated to Captn. Creighton, of the ship Three Bells.
Title page illustration: filigree featuring bells and an enlarged four note incipit / lithographed by Sarony and Co.
Color title page illustration: a sled with two occupants being pulled by a horse through the snow / lithographed by Stannard and Son.
Color title page illustration: red, blue, and yellow curved and ornamented title lettering / lithographed by Concanen, Lee, and Siebe.

physdesc.extent: 1 score (5 pages) and 2 parts (1 page each)

note.p: For voice, piano, violin, and violoncello.
Includes parts for violin and violoncello. The parts are not indicated in the score
Color title page illustration: a woman holding a string of beads amidst a flowery grove with a column in the background / E. M. Selfridge.

scopecontent.p: Title page notes that there are available versions for "high voice in G; medium voice in F; low voice in Eb". This edition is for medium voice in F.

unittitle.title: Pharmacy
Pharmacy : age-less art still majestically marches on,

note.p: Dedicated to the American Pharmaceutical Association.
Title page illustration: floral filigree illuminating the name of the composer.

scopecontent.p: Title page notes "the author endeavors to portray a parallel of the two dramatic arts, - MUSIC and PHARMACY. Exemplifying an exaltation accompanying any creative effort. Despite disappointments and meager encouragement, each never-the-less still lavishly contributes a solace to posterity."

note.p: Attributed to Foster by his friend and collaborator George Cooper, who claims they worked on this song 3 weeks before Foster's death.

Title page illustration: four women in late 1800's clothing with the caption "latest style of spring walking-costumes for March, 1869". Illustration on rear cover: "Latest style of street and ball costumes for March, 1869".

unittitle.title: Give this to mother
Give this to Mother : Stephen C. Foster's last musical idea,

note.p: From a poem by S. W. Harding.
Title page illustration: battle scene depicting the text of the song / lithographed by Deutz Bros.

unittitle.title: I will be true to thee
I will be true to thee,

note.p: Color title page illustration: red and blue filigree in geometric pattern forming a frame around the cover page text, which is the cover for a sheet music series entitled "Foster's melodies" / lithographed by Warren.
Title page illustration: filigree illuminating title text / engraved by Quidor.
Title page illustration: filigree illuminating title text.

unittitle.title: Merry, merry month of May; arranged
Merry, merry month of May : song and chorus written and composed for Clarke's School Visitor (Philadelphia),

note.p: The music, in the Key of B♭, is arranged as a vocal solo with piano accompaniment and as an unaccompanied mixed quartet. The air is Foster's "The White House Chair" arranged in this setting by Foster.
Title page illustration: filigree illuminating title text.

New York (N.Y.): Firth, Pond and Co.
At head of title: "Foster's melodies, no. 25".
Title page illustration: a woman greeting a man at home with children's toys on the floor / lithographed by Sarony and Co.
New York (N.Y.): William Hall and Son
Title page illustration: a watchman looks over a young child sitting on a step on a snowy night / lithographed by Sarony and Co.
New York (N.Y.): Waterson, Berlin and Snyder Co.

Dear is my little native vale,

unittitle.title: Tangled tunes
Tangled tunes: a pot-pourri of 106 favourite melodies humorously entangled,

note.p: Other title: Tangled tunes. Selection of 106 favourite melodies
Color title page illustration: a man in a red cape standing over a cauldron with smoke containing titles of some included song selections / lithographed by W. George.

scopecontent.p: First page of 1st violin score notes "this selection is so arranged that it can be played in two parts, with finish (adlib) at Page 5. The Conductor should instruct the Orchestra before-hand to omit the six bars before 'Lass of Richmond Hill' (19 bars before letter G) if the whole Selection is to be played without break. It is essential for the success of this selection that the tempo should not be changed from tune to tune, but that each melody should run into the next as nearly L'istesso tempo as possible - otherwise the musical joke is lost. Columbia Records of this Selection, Conducted by A. W. Ketèlbey may be obtained".

note.p: Color title page illustration: a bowl of strawberries and cream on a patterned tablecloth / lithographed by Ehrgott, Forbriger and Co.
New York (N.Y.): Firth, Pond and Co.
Title page illustration: the USS Niagara and SS Agamemnon in the water off Newfoundland completing the transatlantic cable, with onlookers on land / lithographed by Sarony, Major and Knapp.
New York (N.Y.): Firth, Pond and Co.
Color title page illustration: a grassy path on the water lined with trees with a rainbow in the background / lithographed by Sarony and Major.
Color title page illustration: a man and two women viewing a rainbow / lithographed by N.E. Lith. Steam.

New York (N.Y.): T. B. Harms and Francis, Day and Hunter
Music includes written text for patter (spoken after 1st verse) and dialogue (spoken after 1st chorus).
Notes that the piece was originally sung by Harry Lauder.
Color title page illustration: photographic portrait of Harry Lauder in costume.
Notes that the piece was originally sung by Madme. Lemmens Sherrington.
Color title page illustration: a young woman in a red skirt sitting outside of a mill / S. Rosenthal
New York (N.Y.): Amsco Music Publishing Co.
At head of title page: Amsco elite series
Color title page illustration: a branch of flowers and leaves / illustrated by Barbelle.
Title page illustration: a portrait of General Ulysses S. Grant in military uniform / lithographed by T. Sinclair's.

scopecontent.p: Bound with: Grand march, illustrative of Stonewall Jackson's way / Chas. Young (New York: J. L. Peters, 1864) (portrait by Endicott and Co. Lith.)

note.p: Lyrics in German and English (by Laura M. Underwood).
"The Morning and Evening Musicale : A choice collection of songs carefully edited and selected for use in the Concert-hall and Parlor."
Title page illustration: two women sitting together / lithographed by Bertauts.

unittitle.title: Waiting
Waiting : song for soprano or tenor,

note.p: "Compliments of HM"--possible inscription by the composer on title page. Back cover: "List of some of H. Millard's recent compositions".
Color title page illustration: a woman standing amidst a field of hay lined with trees / engraved, lithographed and printed by C. O. Clayton.

unittitle.title: I have no mother now
I have no mother now : ballad,

note.p: Notes that the piece was originally sung by Miss Hattie Brown. Dedicated to Miss N. M. Andrus of Buffalo.

Dedicated to Mademoiselle Emilie Wandell by the editor.
Title page illustration: a group of young children playing marbles as a dog scratches his ear nearby / lithographed by Lewis and Brown.

scopecontent.p: 5 movements of the piece are labeled in the score as the following: No. 1. Pantalon, No. 2. Été, No. 3. Poule, No. 4. Pastourelle, No. 5. Finale.

unittitle.title: Love sends a little gift of roses
Love sends a little gift of roses: a ballad,

note.p: Dedicated to Mr. Robert L. Fernald of Brooklyn, New York.
Color title page illustration: title outlined by an oval frame of pink roses with green leaves.

unittitle.title: If you would care for a lonely heart
If you would care for a lonely heart = La tristess du coeur,

note.p: Hartford (Conn.): C. C. Church and Company
Color title page illustration: a portrait of a woman decorated with pink roses / lithographed by Knapp Co. Inc. N.Y. Additional illustrations on verso of title page and back cover.
Lyrics for the voice part do not have their own staff - they are written above the piano staves.
Excerpts from Love's loyalty waltzes by Emil E. Tanner; Silver buckle "Rag" two-step by Jos. Sikorra; and "Dope," a rag novellettee two-step by W.C. Powell on p. [4] and p. [3] and [4] of cover.
Color title page illustration: a man playing football in a uniform with red accents / illustrated by Carl Beck.
New York (N.Y.): Jos. W. Stern and Co.
Title page illustration: honeybees dancing in lineups surrounding a king and queen honeybee.
Detroit (Mich.): Jerome H. Remick and Co.
Color title page illustration: a portrait of a smiling woman with dark hair and red lips.

unittitle.title: Student prince. Serenade ; arranged
Serenade solo [from] the student prince in Heidelberg,

note.p: At head of title: The Messrs Shubert the Student prince of Heidelberg, a stupendous musical production. Other songs available from this production listed on title page.
Color title page illustration: flowery filigree illuminating the title.

unittitle.title: Maytime. Will you remember. Vocal score
Will you remember (sweetheart),

note.p: Duet parts are for female voice (Ottilie) and male voice (Dick).
Color title page illustration: a woman carrying a large bouquet of green flowers and wearing a green skirt / Ray Van Buren.

unittitle.title: Fine old English gentleman
Fine old English gentleman : a popular English ballad,

note.p: Title page notes that the piece was originally sung by Mr. H. Russell. 2nd edition.
Title page illustration: a man sitting with dogs at his feet while a banquet goes on in the background

unittitle.title: Rockaway
Rockaway, or On old Long Island's sea-girt shore : a ballad,

note.p: Other title: On old Long Island's sea-girt shore
Dedicated to Mrs. T. C. Grattan.
Title page illustration: a beach with a ship at sea visible in the distance / lithographed by Bufford and Co.

unittitle.title: True blue lady
True blue lady (a tribute to mother),

note.p: Title page notes that the piece is a "piano solo with words".
Color title page illustration: image based on James Whistler's Arrangement in Grey and black no. 1 (Whistler's mother) of a woman in a blue gown sitting in a chair.

unittitle.title: Parodi mazurka
Parodi mazurka or the Searing waltz : composed and taught by J. H. Searing at his private academy 56 Bond Street,

note.p: New York (N.Y.): William Hall and Son
Title page illustration: a couple dancing / lithographed by Sarony and Major.
Bugle and ophiclyde solos indicated on music.
"Composed and respectfully dedicated to His Excellency, Governor of New York".

Color title page illustration: New York sate arms, with a shield showing the rising sun over a landscape with a canal bridge; below is the state motto "Excelsior." The shield is flanked by two classical figures: Justice (left) with scales and sword, and Hope holding an anchor and a scythe symbolizing agriculture. Above is an eagle holding arrows, olive branches, and a streamer reading "E Pluribus Unum" / F. F. Oakley's Lith.
Cordially inscribed to the Board of Trustees of the Michigan State Institution for the Insane.
Color title page illustration: a scene of a building complex entitled "Michigan Asylum for the Insane" / lithographed by F. F. Oakley's.

unittitle.title: Velocipede gallop
New velocipede : song of the last sensation,

note.p: Addressed to Mercer and Monod, of New York. Dedicated to [his] friend W. T. Winsley.
Title page illustration: a man riding a velocipede while another man watches in the background / Kingdon and Boyd.

scopecontent.p: Title page notes that this is one of two pieces available in this series, the other being Velocipede polka.

unittitle.title: Thou hast learned to love another
Thou hast learned to love another : ballad arranged for the piano forte,

note.p: Title page illustration: a scene of the Oliver Ditson and Co. publisher building in Boston / lithographed by J. H. Bufford.
Pages are out of order, and page 3 is missing. At head of title page: Der frau Metzler-Lutterot gewidmet.
Title page illustration: a cottage in the mountains with scenery covered in snow.

unittitle.title: I've got a pain in my sawdust
I've got a pain in my sawdust,

note.p: New York (N.Y.): Jos. W. Stern and Co.
Other title: Plaint of the little bisque doll
Title page notes that the piece was "sung with Tremendous Success by Kitty Cheatham under the title 'The Plaint of the little bisque doll'".
Dedicated to Miss Kitty Cheatham. Title page erroneously attributes lyrics to Henry C. Warner, a misprint of the lyricist's middle initial.
Color title page illustration: a girl in a white dress leaning over a table with drawings and a doll in the background.
Excerpts from William Vincent Wallace's opera, Lurline, arranged as quadrilles.
Color title page illustration: a scene from William Vincent Wallace's opera, Lurline: Rudolph and Lurline at a feast on the banks of the Rhine river / lithographed by T. Packer ; Stannard and Dixon.

scopecontent.p: No. 1. Pantalon: Sail, sail, on the midnight gale ; Come away to the chase -- No. 2. Été: Overture ; Sad as my soul ; Gentle troubadour -- No. 3. Poule: Take this cup of sparkling wine ; Flow on thou silver Rhine -- No. 4. Trenise: Now with joy ; A father's love -- No. 5. Finale: Though the world with transport bless thee ; Gentle troubadour ; Oh thou to whom this heart.

note.p: New York (N.Y.): William Hall and Son
Title page illustration: a man and a woman in costume dancing / lithographed by Bufford and Co.

unittitle.title: Hail, glorious banner of our land
Hail! Glorious banner of our land,

note.p: Inscribed to Major General George B. McClellan by Mrs. Mary Farrell Moore, Cincinnati, Ohio, July 4th 1861.

Color title page illustration: female figure of Columbia holding an American flag, standing on an axe and wood bundle and in front of a bald eagle, with ships in the background / lithographed by Gibson and Co.

unittitle.title: Freischütz. Schaut, o schaut ; arranged
Wilt thou tempt the wave with me [from] Weber's Der Freischutz,

note.p: Free arrangement of excerpts from the opera's finale for vocal duet with piano accompaniment with words by H. S. Van Dyk.
Title page illustration: a man and woman walking by water with ship in background.

unittitle.title: Mother take me home again
Three beautiful home songs : 2. mother, take me home again,

note.p: Each page is bordered by a filigree frame. First page notes that the piece was originally sung by Rollin Howard.
Title page illustration: a little girl kneeling in prayer amidst toys and shoes on the floor / lithographed by J. H. Bufford.

scopecontent.p: Title page notes that this is a three-piece series, and included is the second piece in the series only.

note.p: Dedicated to Francis E. Brownell Esq. First page also erroneously attributes dedication to Francis C. Brownell, a misprint of the dedicatee's middle initial.
Color title page illustration: portrait of Elmer Ephraim Ellsworth in uniform standing on an American flag.

scopecontent.p: Second title page includes text reading "I am perfectly content to accept whatever my fortune may be, confident that he who noteth even the fall of a sparrow, will have some purpose even in the fate of one like me.".

note.p: Inscribed to Miss Georgia L. Houghton of Buffalo N. Y.
Title page illustration: filigree illuminating title text
First page notes that the piece was originally performed by the Boston Brass Band. Dedicated to Capt. Thos. Dwight, the officers and members of the corps
Title page illustration: New England Guards perform a military exercise in front of the Massachusetts State House / lithographed by Pendleton's.
The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.
